metadata.title: How can I disable old products without customers losing access?

inlineContent.text: Disabling products without users losing access involves three steps:
Disable the checkmark for your legacy product in the ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù tab within FreemiumKit.
Press on ‚ÄúSave Changes to Remote‚Äù on the ‚ÄúPaywalls‚Äù tab within FreemiumKit to save the changes.

Once purchases are created, submitted, and approved on the App Store, you no longer can rename their product ID or safely delete them without losing paying customers. So if you want to ‚Äúclean up‚Äù your products for whatever reasons, it‚Äôs a good idea to keep the existing products on App Store Connect.
With FreemiumKit, it‚Äôs easy to mark products you had created in the past as ‚Äúlegacy‚Äù. First, you need to do some setup within the FreemiumKit app:
For each products you want to mark as ‚Äúlegacy‚Äù, uncheck the checkbox in front of the product in the ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù tab.
Press on ‚ÄúSave Changes to Remote‚Äù on the ‚ÄúPaywalls‚Äù tab.
This makes sure that your legacy products are no longer shown in the paywall. But it doesn‚Äôt give your users access to the features they already paid for.

The App Store Review team may get confused when you submit new products with an app update but your paywall doesn‚Äôt include your old products. Make sure to explain in your review notes that you are no longer selling the old products (you might even rename them by adding the suffix ‚Äú- Legacy‚Äù on Connect) but existing customers will continue to have access.
